description: Ba2!! prevents black's Ba5-c7 plan (preparing e5-e4)
annotation: This move is a strong prophylactic move. This prevents black's idea of Ba5-c7 previously black is intending to play Ba5-c7, reading for e5-e4. Now, the move Ba5-c7 is stopped because of the move Nb5 (the queen can x-tray the c7 bishop and make use of the pin on c6 pawn).

description: Bd4! prevents black's Be7+O-O plan by attacking g7
annotation: This move is a strong prophylactic move. This prevents black's important plan. Previously, black wants to develop the f8 bishop to e7 and quickly castles short. Now, the bishop on d4 is attacking the square on g7. Black hence cannot play Bf8-e7. He has to weaken his own position using the move f7-f6, allowing white to play g4 to exploit that extra weakness.

description: Kh1!! prevents Nxf3+ with tempo (grabbing a1 rook)
annotation: This is a strong prophylactic move. White has to keep pressure on the e5 knight because black cannot easily get rid of that pin (bishop f4-c7 Queen). However, white had the threat of Nxf3 check with a tempo and thus grabbing the rook on a1.
annotation_alternative: Rb1?! - This move is a weak prophylactic move. white does see the threat of Nxf3+ with a tempo and grabbing a1 rook with g7 bishop, yet he did not prevent the idea of Nxf3+ with tempo and e6-e5 push.

description: b5!! prevents black's Bd7-c6 plan (trading pieces)
annotation: This is a prophylactic move. Black's plan is to play Bd7-c6 to trade pieces. Black has fewer space, thus wants to trade pieces to get his pieces out. This b4-b5 move directly stops black from getting his pieces out, prevent the plan of Bc6 trading pieces.
annotation_alternative: O-O?! - This is a risk_avoidance move. He allows black's pieces to be more active, just to let his own king be safer.

description: Qa7!? prevents multiple black development plans (b6-Bb7, Ne5-Nc6)
annotation: This is a STRONG prophylactic move. This is a strong move because it stops black's multiple plans. Black wants to finish his development with b6-Bb7 or Ne5-Nc6. However, with this move, all black's chances to get his pieces developed are prevented. if 1...Ne5, 2.Nxe5 and 3.Bb6 is on the agenda. 1...b6 cannot be played obviously because of the pin.

description: h3!! prevents black's Rxg4 plan (attacking via g-file)
annotation: This is a STRONG prophylactic move. This is a prophylactic move. Black is intending to play Rxg4 and attacking through the g-file. The black's rook has strong mobility. After h3, white is intending to play fxg4 h4, and the activity of black's g8 rook is restricted because black's g4 pawn stops it.

description: Qg2!! prevents Rh4 (attacking h2) while stopping d5 push
annotation: Strong prophylactic move. White sees black's idea of Rh4 trying to grab h2 pawn. Qg2 stops both Rh4 and d6-d5 push effectively.
annotation_alternative_weak: h3?! - This is a weak prophylactic move. This does stops black's idea of Rh4 because of Qg2. But this does not stops the idea of d6-d5 push.
annotation_alternative_weak2: Nc3?! Rh4! - White will be forced to sacrifice a pawn here. Although his position is still better according to engine, from human's perspective, it is now much harder to win.
